description: Introductory high school chemistry covering atomic structure, chemical bonding, stoichiometry, states of matter, acids and bases, energetics, reaction rates, solutions, and environmental chemistry. Designed to build a strong foundation for higher-level chemistry courses.

topics.name: Unit 1: Introduction to Chemistry & Lab Safety
topics.description: Basic chemistry concepts, laboratory safety rules, equipment usage, and proper handling of chemicals.

topics.name: Unit 2: Properties & States of Matter
topics.description: Physical and chemical properties, solids, liquids, gases, changes of state, and density calculations.

topics.name: Unit 3: Atomic Structure & The Nucleus
topics.description: Atomic models, subatomic particles, isotopes, nuclear reactions, and radioactivity.

topics.name: Unit 4: The Periodic Table & Periodicity
topics.description: Periodic trends, element classification, groups and periods, and electron configurations.

topics.name: Unit 5: Chemical Bonding I: Ionic & Metallic
topics.description: Ionic and metallic bonds, lattice structures, properties, and electron transfer concepts.

topics.name: Unit 6: Chemical Bonding II: Covalent & Intermolecular Forces
topics.description: Covalent bonding, molecular shapes, polarity, hydrogen bonding, and van der Waals forces.

topics.name: Unit 7: Chemical Reactions & Equations
topics.description: Balancing chemical equations, types of reactions, oxidation-reduction, and reaction prediction.

topics.name: Unit 8: The Mole Concept & Stoichiometry
topics.description: Avogadroâ€™s number, molar mass, mole-to-mass conversions, empirical and molecular formulas, and stoichiometric calculations.

topics.name: Unit 9: Acids, Bases & Salts
topics.description: pH scale, strong and weak acids/bases, neutralization reactions, and common salts.

topics.name: Unit 10: Chemical Energetics & Reaction Rates
topics.description: Exothermic and endothermic reactions, enthalpy changes, activation energy, catalysts, and factors affecting reaction rates.

topics.name: Unit 11: Water, Solutions & Environmental Chemistry
topics.description: Properties of water, solubility, concentration calculations, acids/bases in the environment, and pollution chemistry.

topics.name: Unit 12: Review, Applications & Final Assessment
topics.description: Cumulative review of key concepts, practical applications, problem-solving, and preparation for final exams.
